p.s: Faraj al-Byarshan, a 41 year-old engineer who immigrated to New York from Iraq in 2005 with his wife and two sons, who came in 2007 after, tells his journey of coming here and his family situation but also his hopes for the future.
Faraj immigrated all alone from Iraq to New York in 2005.
Iraq has or had a bunch of wars and very critical times.
This is why it was better if they would move to New York.
Even his wife and kids came two years after.
Faraj would have been dead at that time, depends which exact place he lived.
On one hand, it was better to move, on the other hand you would never know how the US will treat you.
The US itself can be a quite rude and racist place to immigrate in.
New York in 2005 and 2007 didn't have the new immigration laws, so his family probably needed to go through a lot of insults, teasing and racist comments against them.
Finding a job or earn money could have been hard for them too.
It is certain that people from New York would look down on them each second they would be outside at that time.

Looking at the pros and cons, I think that after the new immigration law in 2015 times have gotten better for the family, even if the mother has known as the wife didntdidn't have someone to help her move to New York with her two sons and lived alone in Iraq for two years straight.
In my opinion I think that it was better for them to move to New York.
Since it would affect their future in a more positive way than it would have ended up in Iraq.

He hopes his family will stay healthy and wontwon't be insulted by anyone, his two sons will graduate school and that to anyone who will migrate to the US or Britain, they will not go through any racism or discrimination like they probably did.
